entry.title: Lab notes: 7 oscilloscope tricks I wish I knew

link.title: Lab notes: 7 oscilloscope tricks I wish I knew

entry.content:
Here are a few scope tips that improved my day-to-day measurements.

  1. Use a tight vertical scale and AC coupling when hunting ripple.
  2. Save reference waveforms to compare before/after changes.
  3. Math channel + low-pass filtering helps reveal PWM fundamentals.

More to come.

entry.title: Building a compact RF signal generator

link.title: Building a compact RF signal generator

entry.content:
I prototyped a small RF generator using an ADF4351 module and a custom filter board. Highlights:

  • Power: clean 5 V with a low-noise LDO and LC filtering
  • Reference: 25 MHz TCXO calibrated against GPSDO
  • Output: 35 MHz – 2.2 GHz with switchable attenuators

Full build notes coming soon.

entry.title: Notes on quiet switching power supplies

link.title: Notes on quiet switching power supplies

entry.content:
A running list of lessons while iterating on a compact buck converter board:

  • Minimize loop area around the switch node; keep the hot path tiny.
  • RC snubbers are cheap; measure and tune instead of guessing.
  • Current loops matter more than copper area alone.
entry.summary: Layout, snubbers, and measurement traps when chasing millivolts.
